title.narrative: 1.19 IMMUNIZATION

description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Immunization. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development

participating-org.narrative: STATE HEALTH RESOUCE CENTRE CG REGD A C

sector.narrative: Immunization supply chain, including cold chain

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: UNICEF continued supporting implementation of Intensified Mission Indradhanush, program launched to achieve full immunization coverage of 90 per cent by 2018. Support was also provided for the Measles Rubella Vaccination Campaign and introduction of pneumococcal vaccine, expansion of rotavirus vaccine in the country and cold chain supply chain strengthening. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2018

title.narrative: Percentage of HPDs that updated National Cold Chain Management Information System (NCCMIS) data at least once in a month

Number of states that introduced Pentavalent vaccine
